title: Yasuo Rework incoming.

embed.description: According to LoLking.net, League of Legends' Yasuo currently sits at an 81.7% ban rate, meaning that the overwhelming majority of all games under the new 10-ban system has locked him out. It's not that he's not popular to play -- it's that his high-risk and high mobility kit makes him unpopular to play against or even alongside.

body: What are some changes you guys would like to see?

Yeah, this is a long time coming. This is well deserved, and no, not because I think he’s broken, nor do I have a hard time playing against him. I eat Yasuo’s for breakfast normally.

Yasuo’s problem is that he’s a “toxic” champion. Riot intended for him to be a high risk, high reward mobile carry, but the way they chose to facilitate his carry potential is inherently flawed. How, you might ask?

-Windwall is a “get-out-of-jail-free” card that is both far too powerful and way too forgiving. It has no cast time and comes from within his own hit box, allowing him to block attacks that are practically on top of him and should be dealing damage. It also lasts a hideous amount of time.

-Flow I don’t have a problem with at its core, but much like Pantheon’s passive, it’s both up way too often and does too much. In Yasuo’s case , his flow shield lasts a bit too long in my opinion.

-His dash is essentially a free zoning tool in combination with his other utility. A high risk champion should NOT have zoning as a strength, but rather, a weakness

All in all, he’s not fun or interesting to play against. When I win, he’s literally just free gold. When I lose, I feel like I’m being beaten by a bundle of gimmicks instead of being outplayed or outskilled.

> [{quoted}](name=AstroWorId,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=E0qm48u3,comment-id=,timestamp=2017-06-09T21:47:25.387+0000)

> What are some changes you guys would like to see?

- No more 0 CD dash. It is the most toxic ability in the game. It allows him to remove interaction from many situations. The biggest change to his kit should be figuring out what kind of tool he can have instead.
- Either remove or rework Windwall, or make Yasuo use mana. The fact that he can react to mana abilities with a free ability that totally nullifies them is patently unfair in lane to many champions. He should need to spend mana for this power or the power should be significantly weakened and be more like Braum's shield. Flow can still be there like how Annie has her stun bar under her mana bar.
- Move the double crit chance from his passive to Last Breath. Instead of giving his crits armor pen, he gets doubled crit chance for 15 seconds. This goes with Riot's philosophy that champions should have meaningful downtime.
- Last Breath does half damage to secondary targets. Yasuo is too overbearing in situations when he's snowballing because he can solo kill several enemies at once using this move that is both CC and burst damage and gives him a power boost after it. The AoE damage should be toned down without nerfing his 1v1 potential.

With those changes I believe he'd need baseline stat buffs but I'd be totally ok with that exchange because his kit is fundamentally game warping from its mechanics.
